summary: The Navy’s public shipyards are critical to maintaining its nuclear-powered aircraft carriers and submarines, as well as supporting its operations around the world. In 2017, we found the shipyards were in poor condition and not meeting the Navy’s needs. In response, the Navy developed a 20-year, $21 billion plan to fix them. However, we found the preliminary plan’s cost estimate is likely understated by billions...
title: Naval Shipyards: Key Actions Remain to Improve Infrastructure to Better Support Navy Operations
